definition: (classical particle similar to 於|于[yu2]) in/at/from/because/than/(classical final particle similar to 嗎|吗[ma5], 吧[ba5], 呢[ne5], expressing question, doubt or astonishment)

sentences.english: Singh struck an unusual friendship with President George W. Bush.
sentences.chinese: 辛格曾于小布什总统建立了异乎寻常的友谊。

sentences.english: All morning I was dreading lunch, fearing his bizarre glares.
sentences.chinese: 整个早上我都在惧怕着午餐，害怕他异乎寻常的怒视。

sentences.english: The window was an embrasure in an enormously thick wall.
sentences.chinese: 窗户是个炮眼，墙壁异乎寻常的厚。

sentences.english: I fear that they will become confused if I behave idiosyncratically.
sentences.chinese: 我害怕他们会搞糊涂，要是我表现得异乎寻常。

sentences.english: Dakar is most affected, due to the unusually heavy rains.
sentences.chinese: 达喀尔由于异乎寻常的滂沱大雨受影响最严重。

sentences.english: He wondered what such unusual brilliancy could mean tonight.
sentences.chinese: 他很想知道，今夜这异乎寻常的辉煌场面意味着什么。

sentences.english: We could make our employment costs unrealistically high.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以让我们的就业成本异乎寻常的高。

sentences.english: The team remains unusually light on star names boasting big-match experience.
sentences.chinese: 队中拥有大赛经验的球星异乎寻常地少。

sentences.english: Demonstrations of this size are exceptional in China's boomtowns.
sentences.chinese: 在中国的新兴城市，这等规模的游行是异乎寻常的。

sentences.english: It astonished me that all of us was keeping absolutly silence.
sentences.chinese: 大家都异乎寻常地沉默，这使我感到吃惊。

definition: increasingly/more and more/ever more/all the more
turned out other than expected (idiom); unexpected
in the extreme (idiom)/incapable of further increase
out of the ordinary/unusually (good, talented etc)
as many as/no less than/not inferior to/as good as/on a par with
